name: Guarantee
documentation:
Represents a delivery or completion guarantee for messages or state changes in Fluxzero.

Guarantees define how long an operation (e.g., sending a message or applying a state change) should wait before considering itself complete.

These guarantees are especially relevant when sending messages through gateways such as {@code CommandGateway} or when scheduling and persisting state changes to the Fluxzero Runtime.

enumConstants.name: NONE
enumConstants.documentation:
No delivery guarantee is enforced.

Operations complete immediately after dispatching, without waiting for acknowledgment from Fluxzero or local processing results.

Use this when performance is more important than confirmation, or when confirmation is handled separately.

enumConstants.name: SENT
enumConstants.documentation:
Guarantees that the message or action was sent successfully.

This includes:

  • Local delivery to registered handlers
  • Sending the message to the Fluxzero Runtime

If a message is handled entirely locally, the operation completes once the local handling is done. If the message is sent remotely, the operation waits for acknowledgment that it was sent successfully.

enumConstants.name: STORED
enumConstants.documentation:
Guarantees that the message or action was stored by Fluxzero.

The operation waits until a receipt or acknowledgment from Fluxzero confirms that the message or state change has been durably stored.

This is the highest level of guarantee and ensures that the message won't be lost even if there is a failure after dispatch.
